question_sentence: Which Oscar winner slapped Chris Rock during this week’s Academy Awards?
Duke and North Carolina will face off in the Final Four of the men's NCAA tournament. How many times have the teams met in this competition?
A flamingo that escaped a Kansas zoo in 2005 was spotted in which state?
This week FedEx announced founder Fred Smith will step down as CEO of the company in June. The idea for the company originated where?
choices: An infomercial Smith saw in his dorm
Twin brothers who approached Smith with the idea

question_sentence: True or false: According to NASA, Scientists have now found more than 5,000 planets existing beyond our solar system.
Bruce Willis is stepping away from acting after being diagnosed with aphasia, which is caused by damage to the part of the brain that controls:
U.S. astronaut Mark Vande Hei returned to Earth, with two Russian cosmonauts, after how many days at the International Space Station?
What percentage of the world’s power was generated by wind and solar power in 2021, according to a report from climate think tank Ember?
The U.S. men's national soccer team qualified for the World Cup this week. When was the last time the team played in the competition?
NASA’s Hubble Space Telescope found the most distant star ever recorded. Light from that star took how many years to reach Earth?
A sculpture of which animal, erected in defiance of planning laws in 1986, has been given protected status by Oxford City Council?
evidence: Magnus Hanson-Heine, whose father created the sculpture, said that ‘using the planning apparatus to preserve a historical symbol of planning law defiance’ was ‘absurd’. For more unlikely news, sign up for our weekly Tall Tales newsletter

question_sentence: A fan of which food chain is planning to visit every branch in the UK in a project that will involve a journey of 415 miles?
evidence: ‘I am completely and utterly Greggs mad,’ said 27-year-old Megan Topping. ‘My perfect date isn’t some fancy dinner, but just a sit-down in Greggs. Just us and a couple of sausage rolls’

question_sentence: Bruce Willis called time on his Hollywood career after being diagnosed with what rare condition that impedes the ability to speak and write?
evidence: Aphasia is characterised by difficulty with language or speech and ‘is usually caused by damage to the left side of the brain’, according to the NHS website

question_sentence: Which Middle Eastern country has placed its security forces on high alert following a string of Islamic State-linked attacks?
evidence: Following three deadly attacks in just over a week, Prime Minister Naftali Bennett warned that ‘Israel is facing a wave of murderous Arab terrorism’

question_sentence: What is the name of the far-right, neo-Nazi military group fighting the Russian invasion as part of the Ukrainian army?
evidence: Formed as a volunteer militia in 2014 to battle Russian-backed separatists in Donbas, the unit was officially incorporated into the Ukrainian armed forces that same year

question_sentence: The Met Police is issuing how many fines in the first wave of  penalties for Downing Street gatherings held during Covid lockdowns?
evidence: Politico’s Alex Wickham reported that government sources ‘expect those fined not to resign from their jobs’

question_sentence: What is the name of the review that found that a ‘dysfunctional culture’ at Shrewsbury and Telford NHS trust contributed to the deaths of more than 200 babies?
evidence: The five-year investigation by independent midwife Donna Ockenden uncovered ‘repeated failures’ in maternity care in Shropshire spanning two decades

question_sentence: What is the name of the Tory who has become the country’s first openly transgender MP?
evidence: Andrew Boff, patron of the LGBT+ Conservatives group, said he hoped that Wallis’ (pictured) announcement would usher in a more ‘respectful’ conversation about transgender rights

question_sentence: Which alleged member of the so-called ‘Beatles’ group of Islamic State jihadists went on trial in the US this week?
evidence: The former British national denies being part of the group that tortured and beheaded Western hostages

question_sentence: Joe Biden was in which country when he said of Vladimir Putin: ‘For God’s sake, this man cannot remain in power’
evidence: US officials were forced to clarify that Biden was not advocating for regime change in Moscow following the ad-libbed remarks in Warsaw

question_sentence: Delegates from Ukraine and Russia met for another round of peace talks in what major world city this week?
evidence: Peace talks in Istanbul produced some optimism for a resolution to the Russian invasion of Ukraine, but continued aggression by Russian forces has all but dashed those hopes.

question_sentence: Will Smith and Chris Rock made headlines when Smith struck Rock during the Academy Awards ceremony Sunday. Smith later won the Oscar for Best Actor in a Leading Role. What movie did he star in to win the award?
evidence: Smith won an Oscar for his performance in “King Richard.” The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences now say they are reviewing his conduct at the ceremony.

question_sentence: This Central American country has declared a state of emergency because of a rising homicide rate fueled by gang violence.
evidence: El Salvador has declared a state of emergency to try to mitigate the violence. A staggering 62 homicides were reported in the country just last Saturday alone.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden unveiled his budget proposal for the fiscal year 2023. In order to fund new projects while cutting back the national debt, he proposed a new plan to enact more taxes on what specific thing or group?
evidence: Biden proposed a plan that would increase taxes for the country’s ultra-rich – those worth more than $100 million.

question_sentence: This state’s governor has signed into law a controversial anti-LGBTQ bill dubbed by critics as the “Don’t Say Gay” bill.
evidence: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis signed a bill into law that bans certain instruction about sexual orientation and gender identity in the classroom.

question_sentence: The House committee investigating the January 6 Capitol riot is seeking an interview with the wife of which Supreme Court Justice after text messages obtained by the committee showed she was communicating with a Trump White House official the day of the insurrection?
evidence: The committee reportedly has text messages showing conservative activist Virginia “Ginni” Thomas, wife of Justice Clarence Thomas, was in communication with then-White House chief of staff Mark Meadows and urged him to continue the fight to overturn the 2020 presidential election results.

question_sentence: Late this week, Russian forces in Ukraine appeared to focus more specifically on the country’s Donbas region. What is the Donbas region?
choices: an area controlled by Russian separatists
a mountainous area with strategically advantageous geography
an area especially rich in fossil fuels
an area with many Ukrainian military installations
evidence: The Donbas region is a politically murky area in eastern Ukraine that is controlled by Russian separatists.

question_sentence: The US Men’s National Team has qualified for the 2022 World Cup after a disappointing eight-year wait. Where is this year’s World Cup being held?
evidence: The 2022 World Cup will be held in Qatar despite years of controversy, allegations of corruption and labor abuses, and the criminalization of homosexuality in the country.

question_sentence: A new show on Broadway will celebrate which worldwide music phenomenon?
evidence: The musical “KPOP” will celebrate the South Korean music wave that has swept the world over the last decade. It will debut later this year and features K-pop superstar Luna, a former member of the group f(x).

question_sentence: What is the name of the coronavirus variant that is now dominant in the US? Experts say the subvariant is more contagious than previous iterations of Covid-19.
choices: they’ve stopped naming them at this point because keeping track is exhausting
evidence: BA.2, a subvariant of the Omicron virus strain, now accounts for more than half of Covid-19 cases in the US.
